body:
Unless you've run a retargeting campaign with us in the past, your first campaign will help you establish a baseline for performance. As you go on to refine your future campaigns, comparing new activity against this baseline will help you see if you're headed in the right direction with changes to strategy, creative, or optimizations. As the man hailed as "The Father of Advertising" said:

"Never stop testing, and your advertising will never stop improving." - David Ogilvy

Budget

Start with $30.

Be conservative with your estimate. Remember that we are on a pre-pay system. You don't want to commit $100 to your budget only to discover that your campaign won't come close to spending that much. Click here to learn how to optimize your budget over time or use our budget calculator to get a per campaign estimate based on your monthly unique visitor traffic.

Audience

The larger your audience, the better your performance.

We set your account up with an All Visitors segment to automatically capture all visitors to your website. This is the segment you will want to target with your first campaign. By establishing a baseline with your broadest segment first, you will better be able to gauge impacts as you narrow your focus.

Ads

Don't just make one, create a few variations so you can learn what your audience responds to!

To complement your target audience, we recommend general brand ads designed to remind visitors of their interest. Remember that your audience is made up of people that have already been to your website! Demonstrating value that the user may have missed on their first visit can help drive engagement. Click here for more creative best practices and here to learn more about your ad options.
